Current State of Coronavirus Cases in Dominican Republic

This article assesses the current state of conronavirus cases in Dominican Republic as at 31th July 2020

Vinny Vu (Master’s Student at Monash University)
08-31-2020

Current State of Coronavirus Cases in Dominican Republic

Coronavirus disease (COVID-19) is an infectious disease caused by a newly discovered coronavirus (“Coronavirus,” n.d.) first reported in December 2019 in Wuhan City in China (Health 2020) Currently there are no specific vaccines or treatments for the disease, (Health 2020) causing many countries to enter quarantines and lockdowns to prevent the spread of the disease. For the purposes I have chosen to assess the state of coronavirus in the Dominican Republic as at the July 31th 2020.

Data has been taken from the coronavirus package from Github (Krispin and Byrnes 2020) which contains data pulled from the Johns Hopkins University Center for Systems Science and Engineering (JHU CCSE) Coronavirus repository which aggregates data from sources such as the World Health Organization and European Center for Disease Prevention and Control (Krispin and Byrnes 2020). Data from the coronavirus package contains tabular data with dates, locations, case numbers and case type included daily confirmed, death and recovered.

Figure 1 is an interactive table showing the summary of weekly cases in the Dominican Republic including the confirmed, death and recovered cases. From the table we can see the weekly confirmed cases increases steadily within the early weeks with the first case in week 1. The growing in cases across time increases at an almost exponential rate showing how quickly the spread of the virus can occur. The weekly confirmed cases peaks at 10,200 cases in week 30. Although the weekly is growing across time the deaths have managed to remain stable staying under 100 cases across the whole period. Weekly recovered cases has however increased across the period peaking at 6,266 recovered in week 31.

Figure 1: Weekly Coronavirus Cases in The Dominican Republic

Table 1 is a static table to show the summary of the cases each month. The table inclues the total/cumulative cases, deaths and recovered at the end of each month showing as at the 31st of July there are almost 70,000 total/cumulative coronavirus cases in the Dominican Republic.

Table 1: Dominican Republic Coronavirus Cases Summary by Month
Month Total Cases Total Deaths Total Recovered
January 0 0 0
February 0 0 0
March 1,109 51 5
April 6,972 301 1,301
May 17,285 502 10,559
June 32,568 747 17,580
July 69,649 1,160 36,470

Figure 2 plots the daily coronavirus cases in the Dominican Republic up until the 31st of July 2020.

Figure 2: Daily Corona Cases in Dominican Republic

This blog post as been made through Distill (Allaire, Iannone, and Xie 2020) with the following R packages:
coronavirus (Krispin and Byrnes 2020), tidyverse (Wickham et al. 2019), plotly (Sievert 2020), data.table (Dowle and Srinivasan 2020), DT (Xie, Cheng, and Tan 2020), lubridate (Grolemund and Wickham 2011) and kableExtra (Zhu 2019)

Allaire, JJ, Rich Iannone, and Yihui Xie. 2020. Distill: ’R Markdown’ Format for Scientific and Technical Writing. https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=distill.

“Coronavirus.” n.d. World Health Organization. World Health Organization. https://www.who.int/health-topics/coronavirus#tab=tab_1.

Dowle, Matt, and Arun Srinivasan. 2020. Data.table: Extension of ‘Data.frame‘. https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=data.table.

Grolemund, Garrett, and Hadley Wickham. 2011. “Dates and Times Made Easy with lubridate.” Journal of Statistical Software 40 (3): 1–25. http://www.jstatsoft.org/v40/i03/.

Health, Australian Government Department of. 2020. “What You Need to Know About Coronavirus (Covid-19).” Australian Government Department of Health. Australian Government Department of Health. https://www.health.gov.au/news/health-alerts/novel-coronavirus-2019-ncov-health-alert/what-you-need-to-know-about-coronavirus-covid-19.

Krispin, Rami, and Jarrett Byrnes. 2020. Coronavirus: The 2019 Novel Coronavirus Covid-19 (2019-nCoV) Dataset. https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=coronavirus.

Sievert, Carson. 2020. Interactive Web-Based Data Visualization with R, Plotly, and Shiny. Chapman; Hall/CRC. https://plotly-r.com.

Wickham, Hadley, Mara Averick, Jennifer Bryan, Winston Chang, Lucy D’Agostino McGowan, Romain François, Garrett Grolemund, et al. 2019. “Welcome to the tidyverse.” Journal of Open Source Software 4 (43): 1686. https://doi.org/10.21105/joss.01686.

Xie, Yihui, Joe Cheng, and Xianying Tan. 2020. DT: A Wrapper of the Javascript Library ’Datatables’. https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=DT.

Zhu, Hao. 2019. KableExtra: Construct Complex Table with ’Kable’ and Pipe Syntax. https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=kableExtra.
